attributes.comment:
I understand that there is a proposal to increase the fees which will affect those
pursuing a foreign adoption. I am opposed to these increases. I am in the midst
of a foreign adoption. The adoption wait time has dramatically increased since I
began the process. I have already received my approval from USCIS, however, I
will most likely have to re-apply as the wait time in China is currently at 16
months from Log In date in China and the approval from USCIS is only valid for 18
months. You do not offer an extension but force those in the waiting stage to re-
apply and pay all the fees over again. I feel we already pay DOUBLE the fees as
most anyone trying to adopt from China will have to submit their paperwork & fee
to the USCIS TWICE! I do not know the wait times in other countries but by
increasing the fees, it is making the cost of adoption prohibitive. We have no
control over wait times, we have already received our approval. Why make it so
difficult and costly? Most children in orphanages in other countries are innocent
victims. Wars, poverty and other dire circumstances put these children at risk.
We, as the United States of America, should stand up and help these children.
Let's not make it more difficult for families to help these children. Let's not add to
the cost. Let's do something positive. Instead of increasing the fees, why not
offer to those who have already been approved an extension at a nominal fee!
Let's help the children and the families helping these children! Thank you!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Maria Batchelor
